metadata.Name: RuCoLA
metadata.Description: RuCoLA is a Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability consisting of 13.4k sentences labeled as acceptable or not. It includes in-domain sentences from linguistic literature and out-of-domain sentences generated by machine translation and paraphrase models.
metadata.Paper Title: RuCoLA: Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2022 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
Affiliations: Center for Information and Language Processing (CIS), Main NLP lab, LMU Munich, Germany
metadata.Abstract: Language Size % Linguistic acceptability (LA) attracts the attention of the research community due to its many uses, such as testing the grammatical knowledge of language models and filtering implausible texts with acceptability classifiers. However, the application scope of LA in languages other than English is limited due to the lack of high-quality resources. To this end, we introduce the Russian Corpus of Linguistic Acceptability (RuCoLA), built from the ground up under the well-established binary linguistic acceptability (LA) resources to explore LA approach. RuCoLA consists of 9.8k in-domain sentences from linguistic publications and 3.6k out-of-domain sentences produced by generative models. The out-of-domain set is created to facilitate the practical use of acceptability for improving language generation.
